speaker: Commencement
lines: Robes whisper like tides around the dais.
Names are spoken correctly on the first try; a miracle of administration.
The Archmage's staff taps stone; the sound writes your name where it belongs.
Bells agree in several towers; the sky signs the diploma in light.
Friends clap the way only people who carried the same nights can clap.
A raven tucks a ribbon into your collar and pretends it was already there.
The courtyard fountain applauds in droplets.
The Dean hands you a focus and a future that is larger than the campus.

give_item.name: Valediction
give_item.description: A disciplined farewell that carries forward
